de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common
Interface ComponentFactory

All Superinterfaces:
Configurable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BTFactory, CDFactory, ClientServerFactory, DefaultTransLayerFactory, FileSharingFactory, GnpNetLayerFactory, SimpleNetFactory, StorageFactory, UC3MNetFactory
public interface ComponentFactory
extends Configurable

Common interface for factories that is used to create components. Typically, each layer implementation will have its own factory implementation. The parameters of the component should be provided via setXY methods. This way a concrete factory can be configured from config files. The simulator's configurator will call setFoo(value) method for each attribute or element foo found in the configuration file (inside of the factory specification element).

Note: This is an instantiation of the Abstract Factory design pattern.

Version:
3.0, 03.12.2007
Author:
Konstantin Pussep, Sebastian Kaune
See Also:
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common

Method Summary
 Component createComponent(Host host)
          Create and return a new component specific to this factory.
 

Method Detail

createComponent

Component createComponent(Host host)
Create and return a new component specific to this factory. The factory may use the host parameter to obtain references to other components required (e.g. overlay factory will typically need a transport manager).

Parameters:
host - - host where this component will run.
Returns:
new component instance
